subject: Personal Finance
title: Why Governments Borrow
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Why Governments Borrow.

hook.text: The US national debt is over $34 trillion. Why does the richest country on Earth borrow at all?

buildup.text: Governments borrow to fund projects that pay off over decades â€” infrastructure, education, defense.

discovery.text: Spreading costs across time means future taxpayers share the burden of things they'll also benefit from.

twist.text: Government debt isn't like household debt. Nations can tax, print money, and roll over bonds indefinitely.

climax.text: The real question isn't the debt size, but whether the borrowed money was spent on productive things.

punchline.text: Nations borrow. The question is what for.

quiz.question: Why do wealthy governments still borrow money?
options: To spread large costs across future generations who benefit
Because they have no tax revenue
